Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans to conform to an accepted code of behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to assume a lying position
= state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
= state in which a countable entity is forty in number
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity

Node.gloss: to be of low esteem|to be held in contempt|to be degraded|to be humiliated
Node.definition: = state/process in wich humans provoke disdain from the general public ◄ due to their lower social standing, poverty, or condition; ≈ people in this situation are generally expected to pay respect to those of a higher standing
= member of same family, clan, tribe, or ethnic group

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which humans place a guard, made of rope or leather strips formed into a loose mesh, over or around the mouth of an animal to prevent it from biting or eating
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= referent to people that are not members of the same group
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= brother of a woman's husband
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

Node.english: perform the duty of a husband’s brother
Node.gloss: to fulfill the duty of producing an heir for one's brother
Node.definition: = action by which a man has intercourse with the wife of his deceased brother, if the brother did not have a son before he died ► to enable a descendance from that brother and perhaps to assure a family for the widow
= first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= causative action by which deities or humans ensure that (other) humans and/or their actions will no longer be remembered
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= wife of a man's brother

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= wife of a man's brother

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal
= brother of a woman's husband
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which someone is willing to do something

Node.english: perform the duty of a husband’s brother
Node.gloss: to fulfill the duty of producing an heir for one's brother
Node.definition: = action by which a man has intercourse with the wife of his deceased brother, if the brother did not have a son before he died ► to enable a descendance from that brother and perhaps to assure a family for the widow
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference
= wife of a man's brother

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

Node.gloss: to take off|to take out|to remove|to draw out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals partially or completely remove an object that used to be attached to another object
= a covering for the foot ◄ usually made of leather or wood ► either open and laced around the foot or ankle with a strap, or closed around the foot like a shoe

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which someone ejects saliva from his/her mouth, usually aimed at someone else's face ► in order to express contempt for that person
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to establish a family line|to establish a dynasty
Node.definition: literally: to build a house (for someone); hence: = action by which humans provide posterity for someone else

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

Node.gloss: to take off|to take out|to remove|to draw out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals partially or completely remove an object that used to be attached to another object
= a covering for the foot ◄ usually made of leather or wood ► either open and laced around the foot or ankle with a strap, or closed around the foot like a shoe
= action by which humans are involved in a violent struggle with other humans, primarily involving physical force
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which a countable entity is the first in a range
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= euphemism for the external reproduction organs; ◄ as the parts that are considered improper if displayed and a cause of shame
= causative action by which humans remove part of an object with a sharp tool

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= receptacle, ◄ made of leather or cloth, ► used to carry possessions, including money

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= state in which animate or inanimate objects are relatively small in size, ≈ which is sometimes associated with a lack of strength, and with insignificance

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 omer (עֹמֶר)
= a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 omer (עֹמֶר)
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= state in which animate or inanimate objects are relatively small in size, ≈ which is sometimes associated with a lack of strength, and with insignificance

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard
= a unit of dry measure of which the exact quantity is unknown and ranges between 20 and 40 liters; one ephah equals 10 omer (עֹמֶר)
= state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

Node.gloss: days grow long > long time passes
Node.definition: literally: days grow long; hence: = process in which a considerably amount of time passes
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= ethnic group living a nomadic existence; ◄ regarded as decendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו) ► regarded as mortal enemies of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ultimately destroyed by Saul (שָׁאוּל)
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another
= action by which someone, or some military unit, assaults someone else from the rear (זָנָב)
= to run out of physical strength
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans have lost their strength as a result of laborious work which requires a lot of energy, either physically or mentally

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= causative action by which deities or humans ensure that (other) humans and/or their actions will no longer be remembered

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly
= ethnic group living a nomadic existence; ◄ regarded as decendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו) ► regarded as mortal enemies of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ultimately destroyed by Saul (שָׁאוּל)

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
